arch:note.arch:string: The purpose of the daily journal was to record the activities taking place in a trench each day. This included which loci were excavated, how and why loci were excavated and the ongoing impressions of the relationships among loci. It should be noted that journals record the actions, impressions and ideas of trench supervisors during the excavations. They are not, therefore, the final interpretations or syntheses of the emerging data.

arch:internalDocument.arch:string:
August 12, 2001

We started by sweeping as usual and now we are leveling L4040 with L4032. We are using a small pick in order to catch the possibility of having a surface here. (We are having a clean section). We are having tons of pottery so I decided to pass to troweling there.

Also we started to articulate L4060. Because we dug the dirt around L4043 yesterday and now we need to open the rocks a little.

In L4040 there are some pottery lying so we are still continuing with the trowels.

We removed L4056, there was nothing unexpected. One of the normal rock features. A grouping of round rocks, only one course. (The interesting thing was that this grouped into two circular parts. These could also be separated into two loci, but they are too close to each other with the same kind of rocks, grouping and style)

Now we are removing L4050, possible from river. Also we found a surface under L4040. It will be locus L4061. I took a set of photos.

In L4057 we found a fish net weight.

Now we will continue to take L4042 while following the surface L4061. There are a few pieces of more pottery there under L4042 that seem to be connected with L4061.

We are continuing to dig L4057 to the West. We found a really nice base. Also there is some reddish dirt at the West side of the L4059.

There is a rock alignment at the West of the oven L4035. Only one row of rocks is there. It is under L4057 and abutting to the oven (touching), composed of 5-6 rocks. It has a slight angle to the NE. The rocks are relatively small, like 5cm to 10cm. They are all touching each other. So I am opening a locus for that: L4062.

Also when I looked at the part that we dug as L4051 yesterday there is another locus there at the South corner of the locus. It has a lighter color with some rocks and a crumbly look. (L4063), which is harder and more compact than L4051.

The reddish stuff next to L4059 seems very bright and may have some burnt stuff there too. So I will look at that tomorrow. It is possible to open a locus for that tomorrow.
